appendix.title: Tinkar Model Concepts
appendix.para: The Tinkar core architecture is designed to be extremely flexible. This flexibility supports the ability to assert relationships among diverse terminologies and to support change in the design of those terminologies. However, it means that there may be more than one way to support any specific requirement. That level of flexibility, by permitting divergent designs, actually impedes interoperability.
We propose the following members of the Tinkar Model Content.

Tinkar concepts are defined hierarchically in a directed acyclic graph. This means that every class concept node in the repository has at least one “parent,” or concept relationship of type “is-a,” with the exception of one root node for clinical content and one root node for infrastructure content.
